content.title: Financial Assistance for Treatment of Chronic Diseases (HBOCWWB)
content.beneficiary: Registered workers under the Haryana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board
content.details: The scheme 'Financial Assistance for Treatment of Chronic Diseases' is implemented by the Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department, Government of Haryana. Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to registered workers for indoor treatment of chronic diseases like Cancer, TB, AIDS, etc. as per government rules.
benefits: Financial assistance up to ₹1,00,000/- for indoor treatment of chronic diseases like Cancer, TB, AIDS, etc.
eligibility: The applicant should be registered under the Haryana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.
The registered worker must have a regular membership for one year.
The workers who are registered and require indoor treatment for chronic diseases such as cancer, tuberculosis (TB), AIDS, etc., are eligible to apply under the scheme.
The application frequency is limited to once.
documents_required: Identity proof i.e. Aadhaar Card, Voter Card
Certificate of Medical Officer of Government or Private Empanelled hospital
Original Bill of expenditure on the treatment

faqs.question: What are the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Registered workers can receive financial assistance of up to ₹1,00,000/- for the indoor treatment of chronic diseases like Cancer, TB, AIDS, etc.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants must be registered under the Haryana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board and require indoor treatment for chronic diseases such as cancer, tuberculosis (TB), AIDS, etc.

faqs.question: What is the minimum membership requirement for eligibility?
faqs.answer: The registered worker must have regular membership for one year to be eligible for the scheme.

faqs.question: What types of chronic diseases are covered under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Chronic diseases such as Cancer, TB, AIDS, etc., are covered under this scheme.

faqs.question: Is there a limit to the frequency of application?
faqs.answer: Yes, applicants can apply for financial assistance under the scheme only once.

faqs.question: How can a construction worker register under HBOCWWB?
faqs.answer: Construction workers can register by visiting the Official Website of the Labour Department Haryana.

faqs.question: Where can applicants apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants can apply for the scheme through the Official Portal - Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.

faqs.question: What documents are required for application?
faqs.answer: Applicants may need to provide a certificate of Medical Officer of Government or Private Empanelled hospital, original bill of expenditure on the treatment etc.

faqs.question: Is there any registration fee required when registering under HBOCWWB?
faqs.answer: Registration fee ₹25/- once in life-time and ₹5/- per month (₹60/-P.A) as subscription fee shall be paid to the Board by the beneficiary.

faqs.question: Is there any provision to continue receiving benefits under the scheme after the death of the registered worker?
faqs.answer: No, benefits will not be continued after the death of the worker.
